byline.contributor: Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Samantha Schmidt contributed reporting.
byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and DAVID GELLES

abstract: Authorities in New York City deploy nation's Wireless Emergency Alerts system to ask public to be on look for Ahmad Khan Rahami, suspect in Chelsea and New Jersey bombings; first time use of system as electronic wanted poster highlights ubiquity of law enforcement in age of terrorism and digital technology.
lead_paragraph: It is believed to be the first such deployment of the nation’s Wireless Emergency Alerts system: An electronic wanted poster was sent out for Ahmad Khan Rahami, who was wanted in the weekend attack.
snippet: It is believed to be the first such deployment of the nation’s Wireless Emergency Alerts system: An electronic wanted poster was sent out for Ahmad Khan Rahami, who was wanted in the weekend attack....

headline.main: Cellphone Alerts Used in New York to Search for Bombing Suspect
headline.print_headline: Cellphone Alerts Are Used in Search for Attack Suspect
